00076 static char *app0 = "MusicOnHold";
00077 static char *app1 = "WaitMusicOnHold";
00078 static char *app2 = "SetMusicOnHold";
00079 static char *app3 = "StartMusicOnHold";
00080 static char *app4 = "StopMusicOnHold";

00082 static char *synopsis0 = "Play Music On Hold indefinitely";
00083 static char *synopsis1 = "Wait, playing Music On Hold";
00084 static char *synopsis2 = "Set default Music On Hold class";
00085 static char *synopsis3 = "Play Music On Hold";
00086 static char *synopsis4 = "Stop Playing Music On Hold";
00087 
00088 static char *descrip0 = "MusicOnHold(class): "
00089 "Plays hold music specified by class.  If omitted, the default\n"
00090 "music source for the channel will be used. Set the default \n"
00091 "class with the SetMusicOnHold() application.\n"
00092 "Returns -1 on hangup.\n"
00093 "Never returns otherwise.\n";
00094 
00095 static char *descrip1 = "WaitMusicOnHold(delay): "
00096 "Plays hold music specified number of seconds.  Returns 0 when\n"
00097 "done, or -1 on hangup.  If no hold music is available, the delay will\n"
00098 "still occur with no sound.\n";
00099 
00100 static char *descrip2 = "SetMusicOnHold(class): "
00101 "Sets the default class for music on hold for a given channel.  When\n"
00102 "music on hold is activated, this class will be used to select which\n"
00103 "music is played.\n";
00104 
00105 static char *descrip3 = "StartMusicOnHold(class): "
00106 "Starts playing music on hold, uses default music class for channel.\n"
00107 "Starts playing music specified by class.  If omitted, the default\n"
00108 "music source for the channel will be used.  Always returns 0.\n";
00109 
00110 static char *descrip4 = "StopMusicOnHold: "
00111 "Stops playing music on hold.\n";

00113 static int respawn_time = 20;

00115 struct moh_files_state {
00116    struct mohclass *class;
00117    int origwfmt;
00118    int samples;
00119    int sample_queue;
00120    unsigned char pos;
00121    unsigned char save_pos;
00122 };
00123 
00124 #define MOH_QUIET    (1 << 0)
00125 #define MOH_SINGLE      (1 << 1)
00126 #define MOH_CUSTOM      (1 << 2)
00127 #define MOH_RANDOMIZE      (1 << 3)
00128 
00129 struct mohclass {
00130    char name[MAX_MUSICCLASS];
00131    char dir[256];
00132    char args[256];
00133    char mode[80];
00134    char digit;
00135    /*! A dynamically sized array to hold the list of filenames in "files" mode */
00136    char **filearray;
00137    /*! The current size of the filearray */
00138    int allowed_files;
00139    /*! The current number of files loaded into the filearray */
00140    int total_files;
00141    unsigned int flags;
00142    /*! The format from the MOH source, not applicable to "files" mode */
00143    int format;
00144    /*! The pid of the external application delivering MOH */
00145    int pid;
00146    time_t start;
00147    pthread_t thread;
00148    /*! Source of audio */
00149    int srcfd;
00150    /*! FD for timing source */
00151    int pseudofd;
00152    AST_LIST_HEAD_NOLOCK(, mohdata) members;
00153    AST_LIST_ENTRY(mohclass) list;
00154 };
00155 
00156 struct mohdata {
00157    int pipe[2];
00158    int origwfmt;
00159    struct mohclass *parent;
00160    struct ast_frame f;
00161    AST_LIST_ENTRY(mohdata) list;
00162 };
00163 
00164 AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(mohclasses, mohclass);

00166 #define LOCAL_MPG_123 "/usr/local/bin/mpg123"
00167 #define MPG_123 "/usr/bin/mpg123"
00168 #define MAX_MP3S 256

00171 static void ast_moh_free_class(struct mohclass **mohclass) 
00172 {
00173    struct mohdata *member;
00174    struct mohclass *class = *mohclass;
00175    int i;
00176    
00177    while ((member = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&class->members, list)))
00178       free(member);
00179    
00180    if (class->thread) {
00181       pthread_cancel(class->thread);
00182       class->thread = 0;
00183    }
00184 
00185    if (class->filearray) {
00186       for (i = 0; i < class->total_files; i++)
00187          free(class->filearray[i]);
00188       free(class->filearray);
00189    }
00190 
00191    free(class);
00192    *mohclass = NULL;
00193 }

00195 
00196 static void moh_files_release(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00197 {
00198    struct moh_files_state *state = chan->music_state;
00199 
00200    if (chan && state) {
00201       if (chan->stream) {
00202                         ast_closestream(chan->stream);
00203                         chan->stream = NULL;
00204                 }
00205       if (option_verbose > 2)
00206          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Stopped music on hold on %s\n", chan->name);
00207 
00208       if (state->origwfmt && ast_set_write_format(chan, state->origwfmt)) {
00209          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to restore channel '%s' to format '%d'\n", chan->name, state->origwfmt);
00210       }
00211       state->save_pos = state->pos;
00212    }
00213 }
00214 
00215 
00216 static int ast_moh_files_next(struct ast_channel *chan) 
00217 {
00218    struct moh_files_state *state = chan->music_state;
00219    int tries;
00220 
00221    /* Discontinue a stream if it is running already */
00222    if (chan->stream) {
00223       ast_closestream(chan->stream);
00224       chan->stream = NULL;
00225    }
00226 
00227    /* If a specific file has been saved, use it */
00228    if (state->save_pos) {
00229       state->pos = state->save_pos;
00230       state->save_pos = 0;
00231    } else if (ast_test_flag(state->class, MOH_RANDOMIZE)) {
00232       /* Get a random file and ensure we can open it */
00233       for (tries = 0; tries < 20; tries++) {
00234          state->pos = rand() % state->class->total_files;
00235          if (ast_fileexists(state->class->filearray[state->pos], NULL, NULL) > 0)
00236             break;
00237       }
00238       state->samples = 0;
00239    } else {
00240       /* This is easy, just increment our position and make sure we don't exceed the total file count */
00241       state->pos++;
00242       state->pos %= state->class->total_files;
00243       state->samples = 0;
00244    }
00245 
00246    if (!ast_openstream_full(chan, state->class->filearray[state->pos], chan->language, 1)) {
00247       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open file '%s': %s\n", state->class->filearray[state->pos], strerror(errno));
00248       state->pos++;
00249       state->pos %= state->class->total_files;
00250       return -1;
00251    }
00252 
00253    if (option_debug)
00254       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "%s Opened file %d '%s'\n", chan->name, state->pos, state->class->filearray[state->pos]);
00255 
00256    if (state->samples)
00257       ast_seekstream(chan->stream, state->samples, SEEK_SET);
00258 
00259    return 0;
00260 }
00261 
00262 
00263 static struct ast_frame *moh_files_readframe(struct ast_channel *chan) 
00264 {
00265    struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
00266    
00267    if (!(chan->stream && (f = ast_readframe(chan->stream)))) {
00268       if (!ast_moh_files_next(chan))
00269          f = ast_readframe(chan->stream);
00270    }
00271 
00272    return f;
00273 }
00274 
00275 static int moh_files_generator(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data, int len, int samples)
00276 {
00277    struct moh_files_state *state = chan->music_state;
00278    struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
00279    int res = 0;
00280 
00281    state->sample_queue += samples;
00282 
00283    while (state->sample_queue > 0) {
00284       if ((f = moh_files_readframe(chan))) {
00285          state->samples += f->samples;
00286          res = ast_write(chan, f);
00287          state->sample_queue -= f->samples;
00288          ast_frfree(f);
00289          if (res < 0) {
00290             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to write frame to '%s': %s\n", chan->name, strerror(errno));
00291             return -1;
00292          }
00293       } else
00294          return -1;  
00295    }
00296    return res;
00297 }

00299 
00300 static void *moh_files_alloc(struct ast_channel *chan, void *params)
00301 {
00302    struct moh_files_state *state;
00303    struct mohclass *class = params;
00304 
00305    if (!chan->music_state && (state = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*state)))) {
00306       chan->music_state = state;
00307       state->class = class;
00308    } else 
00309       state = chan->music_state;
00310 
00311    if (state) {
00312       if (state->class != class) {
00313          /* initialize */
00314          memset(state, 0, sizeof(*state));
00315          state->class = class;
00316          if (ast_test_flag(state->class, MOH_RANDOMIZE))
00317             state->pos = ast_random() % class->total_files;
00318       }
00319 
00320       state->origwfmt = chan->writeformat;
00321 
00322       if (option_verbose > 2)
00323          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Started music on hold, class '%s', on %s\n", class->name, chan->name);
00324    }
00325    
00326    return chan->music_state;
00327 }
00328 
00329 /*! \note This function should be called with the mohclasses list locked */
00330 static struct mohclass *get_mohbydigit(char digit)
00331 {
00332    struct mohclass *moh = NULL;
00333 
00334    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&mohclasses, moh, list) {
00335       if (digit == moh->digit)
00336          break;
00337    }
00338 
00339    return moh;
00340 }
00341 
00342 static void moh_handle_digit(struct ast_channel *chan, char digit)
00343 {
00344    struct mohclass *moh;
00345    const char *classname = NULL;
00346 
00347    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
00348    if ((moh = get_mohbydigit(digit)))
00349       classname = ast_strdupa(moh->name);
00350    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00351 
00352    if (!moh)
00353       return;
00354 
00355    ast_moh_stop(chan);
00356    ast_moh_start(chan, classname, NULL);
00357 }
00358 
00359 static struct ast_generator moh_file_stream = 
00360 {
00361    alloc: moh_files_alloc,
00362    release: moh_files_release,
00363    generate: moh_files_generator,
00364    digit: moh_handle_digit,
00365 };

00367 static int spawn_mp3(struct mohclass *class)
00368 {
00369    int fds[2];
00370    int files = 0;
00371    char fns[MAX_MP3S][80];
00372    char *argv[MAX_MP3S + 50];
00373    char xargs[256];
00374    char *argptr;
00375    int argc = 0;
00376    DIR *dir = NULL;
00377    struct dirent *de;
00378    sigset_t signal_set, old_set;
00379 
00380    
00381    if (!strcasecmp(class->dir, "nodir")) {
00382       files = 1;
00383    } else {
00384       dir = opendir(class->dir);
00385       if (!dir && !strstr(class->dir,"http://") && !strstr(class->dir,"HTTP://")) {
00386          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s is not a valid directory\n", class->dir);
00387          return -1;
00388       }
00389    }
00390 
00391    if (!ast_test_flag(class, MOH_CUSTOM)) {
00392       argv[argc++] = "mpg123";
00393       argv[argc++] = "-q";
00394       argv[argc++] = "-s";
00395       argv[argc++] = "--mono";
00396       argv[argc++] = "-r";
00397       argv[argc++] = "8000";
00398       
00399       if (!ast_test_flag(class, MOH_SINGLE)) {
00400          argv[argc++] = "-b";
00401          argv[argc++] = "2048";
00402       }
00403       
00404       argv[argc++] = "-f";
00405       
00406       if (ast_test_flag(class, MOH_QUIET))
00407          argv[argc++] = "4096";
00408       else
00409          argv[argc++] = "8192";
00410       
00411       /* Look for extra arguments and add them to the list */
00412       ast_copy_string(xargs, class->args, sizeof(xargs));
00413       argptr = xargs;
00414       while (!ast_strlen_zero(argptr)) {
00415          argv[argc++] = argptr;
00416          strsep(&argptr, ",");
00417       }
00418    } else  {
00419       /* Format arguments for argv vector */
00420       ast_copy_string(xargs, class->args, sizeof(xargs));
00421       argptr = xargs;
00422       while (!ast_strlen_zero(argptr)) {
00423          argv[argc++] = argptr;
00424          strsep(&argptr, " ");
00425       }
00426    }
00427 
00428 
00429    if (strstr(class->dir,"http://") || strstr(class->dir,"HTTP://")) {
00430       ast_copy_string(fns[files], class->dir, sizeof(fns[files]));
00431       argv[argc++] = fns[files];
00432       files++;
00433    } else if (dir) {
00434       while ((de = readdir(dir)) && (files < MAX_MP3S)) {
00435          if ((strlen(de->d_name) > 3) && 
00436              ((ast_test_flag(class, MOH_CUSTOM) && 
00437                (!strcasecmp(de->d_name + strlen(de->d_name) - 4, ".raw") || 
00438                 !strcasecmp(de->d_name + strlen(de->d_name) - 4, ".sln"))) ||
00439               !strcasecmp(de->d_name + strlen(de->d_name) - 4, ".mp3"))) {
00440             ast_copy_string(fns[files], de->d_name, sizeof(fns[files]));
00441             argv[argc++] = fns[files];
00442             files++;
00443          }
00444       }
00445    }
00446    argv[argc] = NULL;
00447    if (dir) {
00448       closedir(dir);
00449    }
00450    if (pipe(fds)) {  
00451       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Pipe failed\n");
00452       return -1;
00453    }
00454    if (!files) {
00455       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Found no files in '%s'\n", class->dir);
00456       close(fds[0]);
00457       close(fds[1]);
00458       return -1;
00459    }
00460    if (time(NULL) - class->start < respawn_time) {
00461       sleep(respawn_time - (time(NULL) - class->start));
00462    }
00463 
00464    /* Block signals during the fork() */
00465    sigfillset(&signal_set);
00466    pthread_sigmask(SIG_BLOCK, &signal_set, &old_set);
00467 
00468    time(&class->start);
00469    class->pid = fork();
00470    if (class->pid < 0) {
00471       close(fds[0]);
00472       close(fds[1]);
00473       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Fork failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00474       return -1;
00475    }
00476    if (!class->pid) {
00477       int x;
00478 
00479       if (ast_opt_high_priority)
00480          ast_set_priority(0);
00481 
00482       /* Reset ignored signals back to default */
00483       signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_DFL);
00484       pthread_sigmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &signal_set, NULL);
00485 
00486       close(fds[0]);
00487       /* Stdout goes to pipe */
00488       dup2(fds[1], STDOUT_FILENO);
00489       /* Close unused file descriptors */
00490       for (x=3;x<8192;x++) {
00491          if (-1 != fcntl(x, F_GETFL)) {
00492             close(x);
00493          }
00494       }
00495       /* Child */
00496       chdir(class->dir);
00497       if (ast_test_flag(class, MOH_CUSTOM)) {
00498          execv(argv[0], argv);
00499       } else {
00500          /* Default install is /usr/local/bin */
00501          execv(LOCAL_MPG_123, argv);
00502          /* Many places have it in /usr/bin */
00503          execv(MPG_123, argv);
00504          /* Check PATH as a last-ditch effort */
00505          execvp("mpg123", argv);
00506       }
00507       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Exec failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00508       close(fds[1]);
00509       _exit(1);
00510    } else {
00511       /* Parent */
00512       pthread_sigmask(SIG_SETMASK, &old_set, NULL);
00513       close(fds[1]);
00514    }
00515    return fds[0];
00516 }
00517 
00518 static void *monmp3thread(void *data)
00519 {
00520 #define  MOH_MS_INTERVAL      100
00521 
00522    struct mohclass *class = data;
00523    struct mohdata *moh;
00524    char buf[8192];
00525    short sbuf[8192];
00526    int res, res2;
00527    int len;
00528    struct timeval tv, tv_tmp;
00529 
00530    tv.tv_sec = 0;
00531    tv.tv_usec = 0;
00532    for(;/* ever */;) {
00533       pthread_testcancel();
00534       /* Spawn mp3 player if it's not there */
00535       if (class->srcfd < 0) {
00536          if ((class->srcfd = spawn_mp3(class)) < 0) {
00537             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to spawn mp3player\n");
00538             /* Try again later */
00539             sleep(500);
00540             pthread_testcancel();
00541          }
00542       }
00543       if (class->pseudofd > -1) {
00544 #ifdef SOLARIS
00545          thr_yield();
00546 #endif
00547          /* Pause some amount of time */
00548          res = read(class->pseudofd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00549          pthread_testcancel();
00550       } else {
00551          long delta;
00552          /* Reliable sleep */
00553          tv_tmp = ast_tvnow();
00554          if (ast_tvzero(tv))
00555             tv = tv_tmp;
00556          delta = ast_tvdiff_ms(tv_tmp, tv);
00557          if (delta < MOH_MS_INTERVAL) {   /* too early */
00558             tv = ast_tvadd(tv, ast_samp2tv(MOH_MS_INTERVAL, 1000));  /* next deadline */
00559             usleep(1000 * (MOH_MS_INTERVAL - delta));
00560             pthread_testcancel();
00561          } else {
00562             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Request to schedule in the past?!?!\n");
00563             tv = tv_tmp;
00564          }
00565          res = 8 * MOH_MS_INTERVAL; /* 8 samples per millisecond */
00566       }
00567       if (AST_LIST_EMPTY(&class->members))
00568          continue;
00569       /* Read mp3 audio */
00570       len = ast_codec_get_len(class->format, res);
00571       
00572       if ((res2 = read(class->srcfd, sbuf, len)) != len) {
00573          if (!res2) {
00574             close(class->srcfd);
00575             class->srcfd = -1;
00576             pthread_testcancel();
00577             if (class->pid > 1) {
00578                kill(class->pid, SIGHUP);
00579                usleep(100000);
00580                kill(class->pid, SIGTERM);
00581                usleep(100000);
00582                kill(class->pid, SIGKILL);
00583                class->pid = 0;
00584             }
00585          } else {
00586             if (option_debug)
00587                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Read %d bytes of audio while expecting %d\n", res2, len);
00588          }
00589          continue;
00590       }
00591       pthread_testcancel();
00592       AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
00593       AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&class->members, moh, list) {
00594          /* Write data */
00595          if ((res = write(moh->pipe[1], sbuf, res2)) != res2) {
00596             if (option_debug)
00597                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Only wrote %d of %d bytes to pipe\n", res, res2);
00598          }
00599       }
00600       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00601    }
00602    return NULL;
00603 }
00604 
00605 static int moh0_exec(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00606 {
00607    if (ast_moh_start(chan, data, NULL)) {
00608       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to start music on hold (class '%s') on channel %s\n", (char *)data, chan->name);
00609       return -1;
00610    }
00611    while (!ast_safe_sleep(chan, 10000));
00612    ast_moh_stop(chan);
00613    return -1;
00614 }
00615 
00616 static int moh1_exec(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00617 {
00618    int res;
00619    if (!data || !atoi(data)) {
00620       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "WaitMusicOnHold requires an argument (number of seconds to wait)\n");
00621       return -1;
00622    }
00623    if (ast_moh_start(chan, NULL, NULL)) {
00624       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to start music on hold for %d seconds on channel %s\n", atoi(data), chan->name);
00625       return -1;
00626    }
00627    res = ast_safe_sleep(chan, atoi(data) * 1000);
00628    ast_moh_stop(chan);
00629    return res;
00630 }
00631 
00632 static int moh2_exec(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00633 {
00634    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
00635       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SetMusicOnHold requires an argument (class)\n");
00636       return -1;
00637    }
00638    ast_string_field_set(chan, musicclass, data);
00639    return 0;
00640 }
00641 
00642 static int moh3_exec(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00643 {
00644    char *class = NULL;
00645    if (data && strlen(data))
00646       class = data;
00647    if (ast_moh_start(chan, class, NULL)) 
00648       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Unable to start music on hold class '%s' on channel %s\n", class ? class : "default", chan->name);
00649 
00650    return 0;
00651 }
00652 
00653 static int moh4_exec(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00654 {
00655    ast_moh_stop(chan);
00656 
00657    return 0;
00658 }
00659 
00660 /*! \note This function should be called with the mohclasses list locked */
00661 static struct mohclass *get_mohbyname(const char *name)
00662 {
00663    struct mohclass *moh = NULL;
00664 
00665    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&mohclasses, moh, list) {
00666       if (!strcasecmp(name, moh->name))
00667          break;
00668    }
00669 
00670    return moh;
00671 }
00672 
00673 static struct mohdata *mohalloc(struct mohclass *cl)
00674 {
00675    struct mohdata *moh;
00676    long flags; 
00677    
00678    if (!(moh = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*moh))))
00679       return NULL;
00680    
00681    if (pipe(moh->pipe)) {
00682       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to create pipe: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00683       free(moh);
00684       return NULL;
00685    }
00686 
00687    /* Make entirely non-blocking */
00688    flags = fcntl(moh->pipe[0], F_GETFL);
00689    fcntl(moh->pipe[0], F_SETFL, flags | O_NONBLOCK);
00690    flags = fcntl(moh->pipe[1], F_GETFL);
00691    fcntl(moh->pipe[1], F_SETFL, flags | O_NONBLOCK);
00692 
00693    moh->f.frametype = AST_FRAME_VOICE;
00694    moh->f.subclass = cl->format;
00695    moh->f.offset = AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
00696 
00697    moh->parent = cl;
00698    AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&cl->members, moh, list);
00699    
00700    return moh;
00701 }
00702 
00703 static void moh_release(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
00704 {
00705    struct mohdata *moh = data;
00706    int oldwfmt;
00707 
00708    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
00709    AST_RWLIST_REMOVE(&moh->parent->members, moh, list);  
00710    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00711    
00712    close(moh->pipe[0]);
00713    close(moh->pipe[1]);
00714    oldwfmt = moh->origwfmt;
00715    free(moh);
00716    if (chan) {
00717       if (oldwfmt && ast_set_write_format(chan, oldwfmt)) 
00718          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to restore channel '%s' to format %s\n", chan->name, ast_getformatname(oldwfmt));
00719       if (option_verbose > 2)
00720          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Stopped music on hold on %s\n", chan->name);
00721    }
00722 }
00723 
00724 static void *moh_alloc(struct ast_channel *chan, void *params)
00725 {
00726    struct mohdata *res;
00727    struct mohclass *class = params;
00728 
00729    if ((res = mohalloc(class))) {
00730       res->origwfmt = chan->writeformat;
00731       if (ast_set_write_format(chan, class->format)) {
00732          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to set channel '%s' to format '%s'\n", chan->name, ast_codec2str(class->format));
00733          moh_release(NULL, res);
00734          res = NULL;
00735       }
00736       if (option_verbose > 2)
00737          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Started music on hold, class '%s', on channel '%s'\n", class->name, chan->name);
00738    }
00739    return res;
00740 }
00741 
00742 static int moh_generate(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data, int len, int samples)
00743 {
00744    struct mohdata *moh = data;
00745    short buf[1280 + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET / 2];
00746    int res;
00747 
00748    if (!moh->parent->pid)
00749       return -1;
00750 
00751    len = ast_codec_get_len(moh->parent->format, samples);
00752 
00753    if (len > sizeof(buf) - AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET) {
00754       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Only doing %d of %d requested bytes on %s\n", (int)sizeof(buf), len, chan->name);
00755       len = sizeof(buf) - AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
00756    }
00757    res = read(moh->pipe[0], buf + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET/2, len);
00758    if (res <= 0)
00759       return 0;
00760 
00761    moh->f.datalen = res;
00762    moh->f.data = buf + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET / 2;
00763    moh->f.samples = ast_codec_get_samples(&moh->f);
00764 
00765    if (ast_write(chan, &moh->f) < 0) {
00766       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to write frame to '%s': %s\n", chan->name, strerror(errno));
00767       return -1;
00768    }
00769 
00770    return 0;
00771 }
00772 
00773 static struct ast_generator mohgen = 
00774 {
00775    alloc: moh_alloc,
00776    release: moh_release,
00777    generate: moh_generate,
00778    digit: moh_handle_digit
00779 };
00780 
00781 static int moh_add_file(struct mohclass *class, const char *filepath)
00782 {
00783    if (!class->allowed_files) {
00784       if (!(class->filearray = ast_calloc(1, INITIAL_NUM_FILES * sizeof(*class->filearray))))
00785          return -1;
00786       class->allowed_files = INITIAL_NUM_FILES;
00787    } else if (class->total_files == class->allowed_files) {
00788       if (!(class->filearray = ast_realloc(class->filearray, class->allowed_files * sizeof(*class->filearray) * 2))) {
00789          class->allowed_files = 0;
00790          class->total_files = 0;
00791          return -1;
00792       }
00793       class->allowed_files *= 2;
00794    }
00795 
00796    if (!(class->filearray[class->total_files] = ast_strdup(filepath)))
00797       return -1;
00798 
00799    class->total_files++;
00800 
00801    return 0;
00802 }
00803 
00804 static int moh_scan_files(struct mohclass *class) {
00805 
00806    DIR *files_DIR;
00807    struct dirent *files_dirent;
00808    char path[PATH_MAX];
00809    char filepath[PATH_MAX];
00810    char *ext;
00811    struct stat statbuf;
00812    int dirnamelen;
00813    int i;
00814    
00815    files_DIR = opendir(class->dir);
00816    if (!files_DIR) {
00817       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot open dir %s or dir does not exist\n", class->dir);
00818       return -1;
00819    }
00820 
00821    for (i = 0; i < class->total_files; i++)
00822       free(class->filearray[i]);
00823 
00824    class->total_files = 0;
00825    dirnamelen = strlen(class->dir) + 2;
00826    getcwd(path, sizeof(path));
00827    chdir(class->dir);
00828    while ((files_dirent = readdir(files_DIR))) {
00829       /* The file name must be at least long enough to have the file type extension */
00830       if ((strlen(files_dirent->d_name) < 4))
00831          continue;
00832 
00833       /* Skip files that starts with a dot */
00834       if (files_dirent->d_name[0] == '.')
00835          continue;
00836 
00837       /* Skip files without extensions... they are not audio */
00838       if (!strchr(files_dirent->d_name, '.'))
00839          continue;
00840 
00841       snprintf(filepath, sizeof(filepath), "%s/%s", class->dir, files_dirent->d_name);
00842 
00843       if (stat(filepath, &statbuf))
00844          continue;
00845 
00846       if (!S_ISREG(statbuf.st_mode))
00847          continue;
00848 
00849       if ((ext = strrchr(filepath, '.'))) {
00850          *ext = '\0';
00851          ext++;
00852       }
00853 
00854       /* if the file is present in multiple formats, ensure we only put it into the list once */
00855       for (i = 0; i < class->total_files; i++)
00856          if (!strcmp(filepath, class->filearray[i]))
00857             break;
00858 
00859       if (i == class->total_files) {
00860          if (moh_add_file(class, filepath))
00861             break;
00862       }
00863    }
00864 
00865    closedir(files_DIR);
00866    chdir(path);
00867    return class->total_files;
00868 }
00869 
00870 static int moh_register(struct mohclass *moh, int reload)
00871 {
00872 #ifdef HAVE_ZAPTEL
00873    int x;
00874 #endif
00875    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
00876    if (get_mohbyname(moh->name)) {
00877       if (reload) {
00878          if (option_debug)
00879             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Music on Hold class '%s' left alone from initial load.\n", moh->name);
00880       } else {
00881          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Music on Hold class '%s' already exists\n", moh->name);
00882       }
00883       free(moh);  
00884       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00885       return -1;
00886    }
00887    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00888 
00889    time(&moh->start);
00890    moh->start -= respawn_time;
00891    
00892    if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "files")) {
00893       if (!moh_scan_files(moh)) {
00894          ast_moh_free_class(&moh);
00895          return -1;
00896       }
00897       if (strchr(moh->args, 'r'))
00898          ast_set_flag(moh, MOH_RANDOMIZE);
00899    } else if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "mp3") || !strcasecmp(moh->mode, "mp3nb") || !strcasecmp(moh->mode, "quietmp3") || !strcasecmp(moh->mode, "quietmp3nb") || !strcasecmp(moh->mode, "httpmp3") || !strcasecmp(moh->mode, "custom")) {
00900 
00901       if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "custom"))
00902          ast_set_flag(moh, MOH_CUSTOM);
00903       else if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "mp3nb"))
00904          ast_set_flag(moh, MOH_SINGLE);
00905       else if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "quietmp3nb"))
00906          ast_set_flag(moh, MOH_SINGLE | MOH_QUIET);
00907       else if (!strcasecmp(moh->mode, "quietmp3"))
00908          ast_set_flag(moh, MOH_QUIET);
00909       
00910       moh->srcfd = -1;
00911 #ifdef HAVE_ZAPTEL
00912       /* Open /dev/zap/pseudo for timing...  Is
00913          there a better, yet reliable way to do this? */
00914       moh->pseudofd = open("/dev/zap/pseudo", O_RDONLY);
00915       if (moh->pseudofd < 0) {
00916          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to open pseudo channel for timing...  Sound may be choppy.\n");
00917       } else {
00918          x = 320;
00919          ioctl(moh->pseudofd, ZT_SET_BLOCKSIZE, &x);
00920       }
00921 #else
00922       moh->pseudofd = -1;
00923 #endif
00924       if (ast_pthread_create_background(&moh->thread, NULL, monmp3thread, moh)) {
00925          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create moh...\n");
00926          if (moh->pseudofd > -1)
00927             close(moh->pseudofd);
00928          ast_moh_free_class(&moh);
00929          return -1;
00930       }
00931    } else {
00932       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Don't know how to do a mode '%s' music on hold\n", moh->mode);
00933       ast_moh_free_class(&moh);
00934       return -1;
00935    }
00936 
00937    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
00938    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&mohclasses, moh, list);
00939    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00940    
00941    return 0;
00942 }
00943 
00944 static void local_ast_moh_cleanup(struct ast_channel *chan)
00945 {
00946    if (chan->music_state) {
00947       free(chan->music_state);
00948       chan->music_state = NULL;
00949    }
00950 }
00951 
00952 static int local_ast_moh_start(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *mclass, const char *interpclass)
00953 {
00954    struct mohclass *mohclass;
00955    const char *class;
00956 
00957    /* The following is the order of preference for which class to use:
00958     * 1) The channels explicitly set musicclass, which should *only* be
00959     *    set by a call to Set(CHANNEL(musicclass)=whatever) in the dialplan.
00960     * 2) The mclass argument. If a channel is calling ast_moh_start() as the
00961     *    result of receiving a HOLD control frame, this should be the
00962     *    payload that came with the frame.
00963     * 3) The interpclass argument. This would be from the mohinterpret
00964     *    option from channel drivers. This is the same as the old musicclass
00965     *    option.
00966     * 4) The default class.
00967     */
00968    if (!ast_strlen_zero(chan->musicclass))
00969       class = chan->musicclass;
00970    else if (!ast_strlen_zero(mclass))
00971       class = mclass;
00972    else if (!ast_strlen_zero(interpclass))
00973       class = interpclass;
00974    else
00975       class = "default";
00976 
00977    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
00978    mohclass = get_mohbyname(class);
00979    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00980 
00981    if (!mohclass) {
00982       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No class: %s\n", class);
00983       return -1;
00984    }
00985 
00986    ast_set_flag(chan, AST_FLAG_MOH);
00987    if (mohclass->total_files) {
00988       return ast_activate_generator(chan, &moh_file_stream, mohclass);
00989    } else
00990       return ast_activate_generator(chan, &mohgen, mohclass);
00991 }
00992 
00993 static void local_ast_moh_stop(struct ast_channel *chan)
00994 {
00995    ast_clear_flag(chan, AST_FLAG_MOH);
00996    ast_deactivate_generator(chan);
00997 
00998    if (chan->music_state) {
00999       if (chan->stream) {
01000          ast_closestream(chan->stream);
01001          chan->stream = NULL;
01002       }
01003    }
01004 }
01005 
01006 static struct mohclass *moh_class_malloc(void)
01007 {
01008    struct mohclass *class;
01009 
01010    if ((class = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*class))))    
01011       class->format = AST_FORMAT_SLINEAR;
01012 
01013    return class;
01014 }
01015 
01016 static int load_moh_classes(int reload)
01017 {
01018    struct ast_config *cfg;
01019    struct ast_variable *var;
01020    struct mohclass *class; 
01021    char *cat;
01022    int numclasses = 0;
01023 
01024    cfg = ast_config_load("musiconhold.conf");
01025 
01026    if (!cfg)
01027       return 0;
01028 
01029    cat = ast_category_browse(cfg, NULL);
01030    for (; cat; cat = ast_category_browse(cfg, cat)) {
01031       /* These names were deprecated in 1.4 and should not be used until after the next major release. */
01032       if (strcasecmp(cat, "classes") && strcasecmp(cat, "moh_files")) {       
01033          if (!(class = moh_class_malloc()))
01034             break;
01035 
01036          ast_copy_string(class->name, cat, sizeof(class->name));  
01037          var = ast_variable_browse(cfg, cat);
01038          while (var) {
01039             if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "mode"))
01040                ast_copy_string(class->mode, var->value, sizeof(class->mode)); 
01041             else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "directory"))
01042                ast_copy_string(class->dir, var->value, sizeof(class->dir));
01043             else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "application"))
01044                ast_copy_string(class->args, var->value, sizeof(class->args));
01045             else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "digit") && (isdigit(*var->value) || strchr("*#", *var->value)))
01046                class->digit = *var->value;
01047             else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "random"))
01048                ast_set2_flag(class, ast_true(var->value), MOH_RANDOMIZE);
01049             else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "format")) {
01050                class->format = ast_getformatbyname(var->value);
01051                if (!class->format) {
01052                   ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown format '%s' -- defaulting to SLIN\n", var->value);
01053                   class->format = AST_FORMAT_SLINEAR;
01054                }
01055             }
01056             var = var->next;
01057          }
01058 
01059          if (ast_strlen_zero(class->dir)) {
01060             if (!strcasecmp(class->mode, "custom")) {
01061                strcpy(class->dir, "nodir");
01062             } else {
01063                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "A directory must be specified for class '%s'!\n", class->name);
01064                free(class);
01065                continue;
01066             }
01067          }
01068          if (ast_strlen_zero(class->mode)) {
01069             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "A mode must be specified for class '%s'!\n", class->name);
01070             free(class);
01071             continue;
01072          }
01073          if (ast_strlen_zero(class->args) && !strcasecmp(class->mode, "custom")) {
01074             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "An application must be specified for class '%s'!\n", class->name);
01075             free(class);
01076             continue;
01077          }
01078 
01079          /* Don't leak a class when it's already registered */
01080          moh_register(class, reload);
01081 
01082          numclasses++;
01083       }
01084    }
01085    
01086    ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01087 
01088    return numclasses;
01089 }
01090 
01091 static void ast_moh_destroy(void)
01092 {
01093    struct mohclass *moh;
01094    char buff[8192];
01095    int bytes, tbytes = 0, stime = 0, pid = 0;
01096 
01097    if (option_verbose > 1)
01098       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Destroying musiconhold processes\n");
01099 
01100    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
01101    while ((moh = AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&mohclasses, list))) {
01102       if (moh->pid > 1) {
01103          if (option_debug)
01104             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "killing %d!\n", moh->pid);
01105          stime = time(NULL) + 2;
01106          pid = moh->pid;
01107          moh->pid = 0;
01108          /* Back when this was just mpg123, SIGKILL was fine.  Now we need
01109           * to give the process a reason and time enough to kill off its
01110           * children. */
01111          kill(pid, SIGHUP);
01112          usleep(100000);
01113          kill(pid, SIGTERM);
01114          usleep(100000);
01115          kill(pid, SIGKILL);
01116          while ((ast_wait_for_input(moh->srcfd, 100) > 0) && (bytes = read(moh->srcfd, buff, 8192)) && time(NULL) < stime)
01117             tbytes = tbytes + bytes;
01118          if (option_debug)
01119             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "mpg123 pid %d and child died after %d bytes read\n", pid, tbytes);
01120          close(moh->srcfd);
01121       }
01122       ast_moh_free_class(&moh);
01123    }
01124    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
01125 }
01126 
01127 static void moh_on_off(int on)
01128 {
01129    struct ast_channel *chan = NULL;
01130 
01131    while ( (chan = ast_channel_walk_locked(chan)) != NULL) {
01132       if (ast_test_flag(chan, AST_FLAG_MOH)) {
01133          if (on)
01134             local_ast_moh_start(chan, NULL, NULL);
01135          else
01136             ast_deactivate_generator(chan);
01137       }
01138       ast_channel_unlock(chan);
01139    }
01140 }
01141 
01142 static int moh_cli(int fd, int argc, char *argv[]) 
01143 {
01144    int x;
01145 
01146    moh_on_off(0);
01147    ast_moh_destroy();
01148    x = load_moh_classes(1);
01149    moh_on_off(1);
01150    ast_cli(fd, "\n%d class%s reloaded.\n", x, x == 1 ? "" : "es");
01151    return 0;
01152 }
01153 
01154 static int cli_files_show(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01155 {
01156    int i;
01157    struct mohclass *class;
01158 
01159    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
01160    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&mohclasses, class, list) {
01161       if (!class->total_files)
01162          continue;
01163 
01164       ast_cli(fd, "Class: %s\n", class->name);
01165       for (i = 0; i < class->total_files; i++)
01166          ast_cli(fd, "\tFile: %s\n", class->filearray[i]);
01167    }
01168    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
01169 
01170    return 0;
01171 }
01172 
01173 static int moh_classes_show(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01174 {
01175    struct mohclass *class;
01176 
01177    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
01178    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&mohclasses, class, list) {
01179       ast_cli(fd, "Class: %s\n", class->name);
01180       ast_cli(fd, "\tMode: %s\n", S_OR(class->mode, "<none>"));
01181       ast_cli(fd, "\tDirectory: %s\n", S_OR(class->dir, "<none>"));
01182       if (class->digit)
01183          ast_cli(fd, "\tDigit: %c\n", class->digit);
01184       if (ast_test_flag(class, MOH_CUSTOM))
01185          ast_cli(fd, "\tApplication: %s\n", S_OR(class->args, "<none>"));
01186       if (strcasecmp(class->mode, "files"))
01187          ast_cli(fd, "\tFormat: %s\n", ast_getformatname(class->format));
01188    }
01189    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
01190 
01191    return 0;
01192 }
01193 
01194 static struct ast_cli_entry cli_moh[] = {
01195    { { "moh", "reload"},
01196    moh_cli, "Music On Hold",
01197    "Music On Hold" },
01198 
01199    { { "moh", "show", "classes"},
01200    moh_classes_show, "List MOH classes",
01201    "Lists all MOH classes" },
01202 
01203    { { "moh", "show", "files"},
01204    cli_files_show, "List MOH file-based classes",
01205    "Lists all loaded file-based MOH classes and their files" },
01206 };
01207 
01208 static int init_classes(int reload) 
01209 {
01210    struct mohclass *moh;
01211     
01212    if (!load_moh_classes(reload))      /* Load classes from config */
01213       return 0;         /* Return if nothing is found */
01214 
01215    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
01216    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&mohclasses, moh, list) {
01217       if (moh->total_files)
01218          moh_scan_files(moh);
01219    }
01220    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
01221 
01222    return 1;
01223 }
01224 
01225 static int load_module(void)
01226 {
01227    int res;
01228 
01229    res = ast_register_application(app0, moh0_exec, synopsis0, descrip0);
01230    ast_register_atexit(ast_moh_destroy);
01231    ast_cli_register_multiple(cli_moh, sizeof(cli_moh) / sizeof(struct ast_cli_entry));
01232    if (!res)
01233       res = ast_register_application(app1, moh1_exec, synopsis1, descrip1);
01234    if (!res)
01235       res = ast_register_application(app2, moh2_exec, synopsis2, descrip2);
01236    if (!res)
01237       res = ast_register_application(app3, moh3_exec, synopsis3, descrip3);
01238    if (!res)
01239       res = ast_register_application(app4, moh4_exec, synopsis4, descrip4);
01240 
01241    if (!init_classes(0)) {    /* No music classes configured, so skip it */
01242       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No music on hold classes configured, disabling music on hold.\n");
01243    } else {
01244       ast_install_music_functions(local_ast_moh_start, local_ast_moh_stop, local_ast_moh_cleanup);
01245    }
01246 
01247    return 0;
01248 }
01249 
01250 static int reload(void)
01251 {
01252    if (init_classes(1))
01253       ast_install_music_functions(local_ast_moh_start, local_ast_moh_stop, local_ast_moh_cleanup);
01254 
01255    return 0;
01256 }
01257 
01258 static int unload_module(void)
01259 {
01260    return -1;
01261 }
01262 
01263 AST_MODULE_INFO(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, AST_MODFLAG_DEFAULT, "Music On Hold Resource",
01264       .load = load_module,
01265       .unload = unload_module,
01266       .reload = reload,
01267           );
